visualization_prompt: Generate a Highcharts combination chart showing a normal distribution curve with standard deviation zones and overlaid synthetic data points. Use gradient fills for standard deviation bands and direct percentage labels.
visualization_explanation: The visualization combines a probability density curve (μ=55, σ=5) with synthetic normally distributed data points. The x-axis shows measurement values while the y-axis displays relative probability density. Three standard deviation zones are implemented with decreasing opacity gradients (68%/95%/99.7% rule), using color saturation from Cairo's perceptual hierarchy. Scatterplot markers use preattentive red-orange coloring for immediate visual separation from the blue density curve. Synthetic data follows N(55,5²) distribution with Q-Q plot validation. Chart configuration adheres to Tufte's data-ink maximization through axis simplification and removal of non-essential gridlines.
